resource_dependency.map_api: An interactive map API such as Mapbox or Leaflet.js capable of rendering geographic boundaries and handling click events on regions.
resource_dependency.neighborhood_data_schema: Database table named 'neighborhoods' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), boundary_geojson (GeoJSON), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp).

function: Display an interactive map that allows users to visualize neighborhood boundaries and select specific areas for data analysis.
static_description: A full-width map container rendered using the map_api, centered on a default location. Neighborhood boundaries are pre-loaded and styled with forest green strokes. Background color set to ivory.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a neighborhood boundary selects it visually, highlighting it in forest green fill, and displays its basic info panel below the map.
Hovering over a neighborhood boundary temporarily highlights it with a semi-transparent forest green overlay.

resource_dependency.comparison_state_schema: Database schema tracking user-defined comparisons with tables: comparison_sessions(id UUID), session_neighborhoods(session_id UUID references comparison_sessions.id, neighborhood_id UUID references neighborhoods.id)

function: Allow users to select multiple neighborhoods and initiate a comparison between them.
static_description: A floating control bar above the map containing a 'Compare' button with compare_button_icon, disabled by default until two or more neighborhoods are selected. Selected neighborhoods appear as chips within the control bar.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the 'Compare' button navigates the user to the comparison dashboard view populated with selected neighborhood data fetched via API.
Clicking a neighborhood chip removes it from the current selection and updates the map highlight accordingly.

resource_dependency.demographics_data_schema: Table demographics(neighborhood_id UUID references neighborhoods.id, population integer, median_age float, households integer, year_built_median integer, created_at timestamp)

function: Fetch and visualize demographic data including population, age distribution, and household information for selected neighborhoods.
static_description: A tabbed section showing demographic metrics in chart form (bar/column charts). Charts use forest green bars against an ivory background. Default view shows total population per selected neighborhood.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking different tabs switches the displayed chart to show median age, number of households, or median year built.
Hovering over individual chart elements reveals tooltips with precise numeric values.

resource_dependency.economic_data_schema: Table economics(neighborhood_id UUID references neighborhoods.id, median_income decimal, unemployment_rate float, median_rent decimal, median_home_value decimal, created_at timestamp)

function: Visualize economic indicators like income levels, employment rates, and housing costs for selected neighborhoods.
static_description: A dedicated section displaying economic KPI cards for each selected neighborhood, featuring metrics like median income and unemployment rate. Additional line graphs plot trends over time if available.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on metric cards expands a modal with historical trend charts related to that metric.
Hovering over chart points shows detailed value labels.

resource_dependency.crime_data_schema: Table crimes(incident_id UUID, neighborhood_id UUID references neighborhoods.id, incident_type string, reported_at timestamp, description text)

function: Show filtered crime statistics categorized by type and time period for chosen neighborhoods.
static_description: A filterable panel with dropdown menus for selecting crime type and date range, followed by a stacked bar chart representing incidents by month. Chart colors follow forest green shades.

interaction_and_states.description: Changing selections in the filters triggers a re-fetch of crime data and redraws the chart accordingly.
Hovering over segments of the stacked bar chart displays counts and percentages for each category.

resource_dependency.dashboard_layout_engine: Frontend library for managing draggable/resizable widget containers such as react-grid-layout.
resource_dependency.widget_config_schema: User-specific layout stored in localStorage or backend under user_preferences(widget_positions JSON)

function: Provide a customizable dashboard layout enabling users to arrange and resize various data visualization widgets.
static_description: A grid-based canvas filled with resizable chart widgets arranged according to saved preferences. Widgets include demographic, economic, and crime charts with drag handles visible only when editing.

interaction_and_states.description: Dragging a widget header moves it around the grid, updating positions dynamically.
Resizing a corner anchor adjusts the dimensions of the widget and persists after save.
Clicking the 'Save Layout' button stores the new configuration either locally or server-side depending on login status.

resource_dependency.sort_filter_controls: Reusable UI component supporting multi-column sort and column-based filters.

function: Enable filtering and sorting capabilities across all displayed datasets throughout the application.
static_description: Each data table or chart view includes inline filter icons next to column headers and global search/filter controls atop the main content area. Controls utilize forest green accents.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a column header cycles through ascending/descending/no sort states, triggering a refresh of the dataset with sorted results.
Clicking a filter icon opens a popover menu where users can apply value ranges or categorical filters which update the dataset upon submission.

function: Ensure responsive design compatibility for both desktop and tablet screen sizes.
static_description: Layout adapts fluidly based on viewport size. Desktop mode uses sidebar navigation; tablet mode collapses into a top navbar with hamburger-style mobile_navigation_menu.

interaction_and_states.description: As window width crosses breakpoints, layout shifts automatically between desktop and tablet modes without requiring page reload.
Tapping the hamburger icon toggles visibility of the slide-in navigation drawer on smaller screens.

function: Apply consistent ivory background color throughout the entire application interface.
static_description: Entire app body background uniformly colored with ivory (#FFFFF0) defined via CSS variable --background-color.

resource_dependency.interactive_component_styles: .button-primary { background-color: var(--primary-color); border: 1px solid var(--primary-color); } .highlight-text { color: var(--primary-color); }

function: Use forest green color for interactive components and highlights throughout the UI.
static_description: Buttons, links, active tabs, and important highlights are styled using forest green (#228B22) defined via CSS variable --primary-color.

interaction_and_states.description: Buttons and interactive elements darken slightly in shade when hovered, providing visual feedback.
Focused interactive elements receive a subtle glow effect matching forest green tone.

resource_dependency.comparison_manager_ui: <ComparisonManager /> manages active selections and comparison logic

function: Implement intuitive UI controls for selecting neighborhoods and managing ongoing comparisons.
static_description: Integrated controls positioned near the map include checkboxes/radio buttons for area selection and a clear 'Manage Comparisons' panel listing currently selected items.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting/unselecting an area adds/removes it from the active comparison group and updates dependent views instantly.
Clicking 'Clear All' in the comparison manager resets all selections and returns the map to base state.

resource_dependency.package_json_config: { "scripts": { "install:all": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm install\" \"cd backend && npm install\"", "dev": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm run dev\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\"" }}

function: Configure package.json scripts to support installation and concurrent development startup of both frontend and backend.
static_description: Root-level package.json file contains install:all and dev script definitions ensuring simultaneous setup and launch of both applications using concurrently tool.
